title: Get connection details for connecting to the IdM service (AKS)
content:
This topic contains instructions on how to integrate OO with the IdM service.

You'll use the information obtained from Generate sensitive data for OO in the following steps.

Obtain the password for the IdM transport user

Run the following commands on the bastion node to obtain the password from Service Management's vault for the user idmTransportUser. You'll need to use this user for the integration between OO and IdM.

  • Get Service Management namespace name: 
    SMAX_NS=$(echo `kubectl get ns | grep itsma | awk '{print $1}'`) && echo $SMAX_NS
  • Get Service Management's IdM pod name: 
    SMAX_IDM_POD=$(echo `kubectl get pods -n $SMAX_NS | grep -m1 idm- | head -1 | awk '{print $1}'`) && echo $SMAX_IDM_POD
  • Get the password for Service Management's IdM user idmTransportUser: 
    TRANSPORT_PASS=$(kubectl exec -it $SMAX_IDM_POD -n $SMAX_NS -c idm -- bash -c "/bin/get_secret idm_transport_admin_password_secret_key" | awk -F= '{print$2}') && echo $TRANSPORT_PASS
